intro: Cinchona bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its strikingly variegated leaves with white and green patterns. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and red berries, which are important for its ecological role. It is notable for containing alkaloids, including quinine, which has historically been used in medicine. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal significance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
